text: <@U0260PT3J4T> / <@U01S2E62L0N> - Looks like the beta for this feature has not been released to everyone yet. We contacted <@U7SL518D6> and he and support helped us roll this out to our accounts :).
That’s good to know that feature is in the works. Thanks <@U0284NAP353>!

Hi HubSpot Fam!

Does anyone know how to update the dropdown name for Subscription templates (Subscription preference page, Subscription update confirmation page, and Unknown contact subscription preferences)? This displays in the dropdown on the Subscriptions settings pages. It currently only displays the file name and surprisingly not the template label.

Yes <@U0284NAP353> Thank you very much for the reply !
I was able to hack through this and our blog page listing is up, but all custom fields have to be done in dev.
It will be much easier for other contributors to find and modify page settings if it is like the others on the page list.

You would want to check on the label for the templates in the template annotation. You can view more on HTML + HubL templates and annotations here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/templates/html-hubl-templates#template-annotations>
Hey all, glad you’re excited about this feature. This functionality is in beta and is slowly rolling out to accounts. I will check if we can provide an ETA.

We expect the feature to rollout to everyone within a couple months.

If you DM me with the following I can get you access now.
• portal id:
• email address:
Also be aware if you send me that information, you are agreeing to our <https://legal.HubSpot.com/HubSpot-beta-terms|beta terms>.
Your email address provided for this is only used in the event we need to contact you in-relation to this beta.
Hm. Strange. For some reason the label is ignored. It's happening for the boilerplate as well. Double checking again. Thanks <@U2H3TT8F2>!
I would just use the `replace` filter — ive used it a handful of times on the standard_header_includes variable
